intro: Meibomia aparines, commonly known as the white meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite, simple, and elliptical in shape. Meibomia aparines is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
